intro: Scorzoneroides pyrenaica subsp. cantabrica, commonly known as the Cantabrian scorzonera, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate leaves and yellow flowers arranged in a single head. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils in mountainous regions. It is adapted to harsh, high-altitude environments and is relatively rare. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
